math/statistic/singlestatisticvalue.detaildescription:
The action returns for each statistic object the statistic value, the first argument is a string with the statitic value name (geometricmean, max, min, count, populationvariance, quadraticmean, secondmoment, standarddeviation, sum, sumlog, sumsquare, variance, mean, kurtiosis) all other arguments are statistic objects 
[V1|V2|V3]=math/statistic/getstatisticvalue("mean|min|max|...",Statistic1,[Statistic2,Statistic3]);

math/blas/matrix/singularvalue.name: math/blas/matrix/singularvalue
math/blas/matrix/singularvalue.briefdescription: creates the singular value decomposition of a matrix.
math/blas/matrix/singularvalue.detaildescription:
For each input matrix the singular value decompisition is called and the values, and the two matrixes (left / right) are returned, the action never fails 
[Values1|U1|V1|Values2|U2|V2]=blas/matrix/singularvalue(Matrix1,Matrix2);

math/sinh.name: math/sinh
math/sinh.detaildescription:
For each unflatten input argument the $ sinh( x_i ) $ is calculated and the action never fails 
[X|Y|Z]=math/sinh(3.2,[5,8,[1.2]]);

math/bit/matrix/size.name: math/bit/matrix/size
math/bit/matrix/size.briefdescription: returns the size (rows * columns) of the matrix.
math/bit/matrix/size.detaildescription:
All input matrix objects will return their size (number of bits for the rows * columns), the action never fails 
[A|B]=math/bit/matrix/size(Matrix1,Matrix2);

string/size.name: string/size
string/size.briefdescription: action to get the string length.
string/size.detaildescription:
For each argument the string length will be returned and the action never fails 
[A|B|C]=generic/string/size("A",["CC","XYZ"]);

math/bit/vector/size.name: math/bit/vector/size
math/bit/vector/size.briefdescription: returns the size of the vector.
math/bit/vector/size.detaildescription:
All input vector objects will return their size (number of bits), the action never fails 
[A|B]=math/bit/vector/size(Vector1,Vector2);

math/blas/size.name: math/blas/size
math/blas/size.briefdescription: returns the elements within the BLAS structure.
math/blas/size.detaildescription:
The action returns the size of each BLAS structure 
[S1|S2|S3]=math/blas/size(M1,[M2,M3]);

collection/size.name: collection/size
collection/size.briefdescription: returns the size of the collection.
collection/size.detaildescription:
All arguments must be collections and the action returns the size of each collection, the action never fails 
[A|B|C|D]=collection/size(Collection,Map,MultiMap,Tupel);
note: on non-collection type the action returns a zero value

agent/sleep.name: agent/sleep
agent/sleep.briefdescription: sets the agent to the sleep state.
agent/sleep.detaildescription:
The action applys the sleep state of the current agent. The first optional argument can be a sleeping time (in agent cycles) 
agent/sleep(3);

math/linearprogram/solve.name: math/linearprogram/solve
math/linearprogram/solve.briefdescription: solves the linear program and returns the solution.
math/linearprogram/solve.detaildescription:
The action solves the linear program and returns the solution. The first argument is the linear program, all other arguments can be a number or a string with the definition:
  • maximize / minimize defines the optimization goal
  • non-negative defines all variables with non-negative values
  • number is the number of iteration for solving
The return arguments are at the first the value, second the number of all referenced $ x_i $ points and after that all arguments the values of $ x_i $ 
[Value|CountXi|Xi]=math/linearprogram/solve(LP,"maximize","non-negative");

math/blas/matrix/solve.name: math/blas/matrix/solve
math/blas/matrix/solve.detaildescription:
The action solve the equation $ A \cdot X = B $ for each input tuple, $ A $ is the first matrix argument within the tuple and $ B $ the second, which can be a matrix or vector, for each tuple the action returns $ X $, the action never fails 
[R1|R2]=math/blas/matrix(Matrix1,Matrix2,[Matrix3,Vector1]);

graph/spanningtree.name: graph/spanningtree
graph/spanningtree.briefdescription: creates a minimal spanning tree of a graph.

math/sqrt.name: math/sqrt
math/sqrt.detaildescription: Calculates the square-root for each unflatten argument $ \sqrt{ x_i } $

string/startswith.name: string/startswith
string/startswith.briefdescription: action to check string for starts-with.
string/startswith.detaildescription:
The acion checks the string, that is the first argument, with each other arguments for the operation starts-with, the action never fails 
[L1|L2]=generic/string/startswith("thisisalongstring","longstring","string");

math/stirling.name: math/stirling
math/stirling.detaildescription:
The action calculates the stirling number with $ S(n,k)=\left\{\begin{matrix} n \\ k \end{matrix}\right\}= S_n^{(k)} $ of each tuple of the unflatten argument list, n is the first value of the tupel and k is the second value of the tupel, the action fails never 
[S1|S2]=math/stirling(2,3,[4,5]);

collection/list/sublist.name: collection/list/sublist
collection/list/sublist.briefdescription: returns a sublist within the index range.
collection/list/sublist.detaildescription:
Creates a sublist of an existing list by an index range, first argument is the list object, second the lower-bound, third the upper-bound within the range $ [ \text{lower-bound}, \text{upper-bound} ) $, the action fails never 
LS=collection/list/get(L,2,5);

math/blas/matrix/submatrix.name: math/blas/matrix/submatrix
math/blas/matrix/submatrix.detaildescription:
The first four arguments defines the index values of the submatrix ( from/to row, from/to column ) and each matrix object that starts at the fiveth position will 
[M1|M2]=math/blas/matrix/submatrix(FromRow,ToRow,FromColumn,ToColumn,Matrix1,[Matrix2]);

graph/successorcount.name: graph/successorcount
graph/successorcount.briefdescription: returns the number of successors within a graph.
graph/successorcount.detaildescription:
The action returns for the first vertex argument the number of successors on all other graph arguments, the action never fails 
[C1|C2]=graph/successorcount(Vertex,Graph1,Graph2);

math/sum.name: math/sum
math/sum.detaildescription:
Sums all unflatten arguments $ \sum_{i} x_i $, the action never fails 
S=math/sum(3,4,[1,-5,[3,4]],10,12);

math/blas/matrix/sum.name: math/blas/matrix/sum
math/blas/matrix/sum.detaildescription:
Calculates for each input matrix the sum and returns the value, the action never fails 
[S1|S2]=math/blas/matrix/sum(M1,M2);

math/blas/vector/sum.name: math/blas/vector/sum
math/blas/vector/sum.detaildescription:
Calculates for each input vector the sum and returns the value, the action never fails 
[S1|S2]=math/blas/vector/sum(V1,V2);

collection/list/symmetricdifference.name: collection/list/symmetricdifference
collection/list/symmetricdifference.briefdescription: creates the symmetric difference between lists (difference of union and intersection).
collection/list/symmetricdifference.detaildescription:
Creates the symmetric difference of all arguments, so all arguments are collections and the action will return a list with the symmetric difference $ (\mathbb{X} \setminus \mathbb{Y}) \cup (\mathbb{B} \setminus \mathbb{A}) $, the action fails never 
D=collection/list/symmetricdifference([1,2,[3,4]],[7,8,9,4],[[1,2],[3]]);

math/tan.name: math/tan
math/tan.detaildescription:
The action calculates for each unflatten input value in radians the $ tan( x_i ) $ value, the action never fails 
[X|Y|Z]=math/tan(pi,1.3*pi,0.43*pi);

math/tanh.name: math/tanh
math/tanh.detaildescription:
Calculates for each unflatten argument $ tanh( x_i ) $ and fails never 
[A|B|C]=math/tanh([1,2],3);

generic/throw.name: generic/throw
generic/throw.briefdescription: action for throwing a runtime execption.
generic/throw.detaildescription:
The action fails never but throws a Java runtime exception on a boolean condition, the first argument is a boolean value on true the exception is thrown, second argument can be a string with a message 
generic/throw(true,"amessage");
note: the exception must be catched outside the agent call method

datetime/time.name: datetime/time
datetime/time.briefdescription: action for getting the current time.
datetime/time.detaildescription:
The action returns the time elements of a parsed string or date-time object, if the string is empty or "now" the current date-time is used, the action fails on wrong input 
[Hour|Minute|Second|Nano]=datetime/time("now");

generic/type/to.name: generic/type/to
generic/type/to.briefdescription: action to cast any java object type.
generic/type/to.detaildescription:
The action casts any value to the given full-qualified class name in the first argument, the action fails on casting errors 
[A|B]=generic/type/to("java.lang.String",X,Y);

math/bit/vector/toblas.name: math/bit/vector/toblas
math/bit/vector/toblas.briefdescription: converts the bit vector to a blas vector.
math/bit/vector/toblas.detaildescription:
The action converts the bit vector to a blas vector, the last argument can be "dense" or "sparse", all other arguments are bit vectors and the actions never fails 
[A|B]=math/bit/vector/blas(Bit1,Bit2,"dense|sparse");

generic/type/tofloat.name: generic/type/tofloat
generic/type/tofloat.briefdescription: action to cast a value to an floating-point value.
generic/type/tofloat.detaildescription:
Cast any argument into a floating-point number, the action fails on casting errors 
[N1|N2]=generic/type/tofloat(X,Y);

generic/type/toint.name: generic/type/toint
generic/type/toint.briefdescription: action to cast a value to an integer value.
generic/type/toint.detaildescription:
Cast any argument into an integer number, the action fails on casting errors 
[N1|N2]=generic/type/tofloat(X,Y);

math/bit/vector/tolist.name: math/bit/vector/tolist
math/bit/vector/tolist.briefdescription: returns the long values of the bit vector as list.
math/bit/vector/tolist.detaildescription:
The action creates a list with 0 / 1 values of the values of the bit vector, the action never fails 
[L1|L2]=math/bit/vector/tolist(Vector1,Vector2);

math/blas/matrix/tolist.name: math/blas/matrix/tolist
math/blas/matrix/tolist.briefdescription: converts a matrix rowise to a list.
math/blas/matrix/tolist.detaildescription:
The action creates lists of each input matrix, the action never fails 
[L1|L2|L3]=math/blas/matrix/tolist(Matrix1,[Matrix2,Matrix3]);

math/blas/vector/tolist.name: math/blas/vector/tolist
math/blas/vector/tolist.briefdescription: converts a vector to a list.
math/blas/vector/tolist.detaildescription:
The action creates lists of each input vector, the action never fails 
[L1|L2|L3]=math/blas/vector/tolist(Vector1,[Vector2,Vector3]);

generic/type/tostring.name: generic/type/tostring
generic/type/tostring.briefdescription: converts a value into the string represenation.
generic/type/tostring.detaildescription: The action converts any argument into the string represenation, the action never fails

math/bit/matrix/tovector.name: math/bit/matrix/tovector
math/bit/matrix/tovector.briefdescription: converts the bit matrix into a bit vector.
math/bit/matrix/tovector.detaildescription:
The action converts each bit matrix argument into a bit vector with the size of the matrix, the bit within the vector are row-wise copied from the matrix and the action never fails 
[V1|V2]=math/bit/matrix/tovector(Matrix1,Matrix2);

math/blas/matrix/trace.name: math/blas/matrix/trace
math/blas/matrix/trace.briefdescription: creates the trace of the matrix.
math/blas/matrix/trace.detaildescription:
Returns for each matrix input argument the trace, the action never fails 
[T1|T2]=math/blas/matrix/trace(M1,M2);

math/blas/matrix/transpose.name: math/blas/matrix/transpose
math/blas/matrix/transpose.detaildescription:
Creates for each input matrix the transposed matrix and returns it, the action never fails 
[T1|T2]=math/blas/matrix/transpose(M1,M2);

math/bit/matrix/truecount.name: math/bit/matrix/truecount
math/bit/matrix/truecount.briefdescription: returns the number of true values.
math/bit/matrix/truecount.detaildescription:
The actions returnf for each input matrix the number of true values, the action never fails 
[A|B]=math/bit/matrix/truecount(BitMatrix1,BitMatrix2);

math/bit/vector/truecount.name: math/bit/vector/truecount
math/bit/vector/truecount.briefdescription: returns the number of true values.
math/bit/vector/truecount.detaildescription:
The actions returnf for each input vector the number of true values, the action never fails 
[A|B]=math/blas/vector/truecount(BitVector1,BitVector2);

math/blas/matrix/twonorm.name: math/blas/matrix/twonorm
math/blas/matrix/twonorm.briefdescription: returns the two-norm of a matrix.
math/blas/matrix/twonorm.detaildescription:
Calculates for each input matrix the two-norm and returns the value, the action never fails 
[N1|N2]=math/blas/matrix/twonorm(M1,M2);

collection/list/union.name: collection/list/union
collection/list/union.briefdescription: creates the union between lists (not unique).
collection/list/union.detaildescription:
Creates the union of all arguemnts with removing nested structures $ \cup X_i \forall i \in \mathbb{N} $, the action fails never 
U=collection/list/union(L,[1,2],[3,4,[5,6]];

collection/list/unique.name: collection/list/unique
collection/list/unique.briefdescription: returns an unique list of the list.
collection/list/unique.detaildescription:
All arguments are collections and the action removes nested structures and returns a list with unique elements, the action fails never 
U=collection/list/unique(L);

string/upper.name: string/upper
string/upper.briefdescription: action to create an upper-case string.
string/upper.detaildescription:
All arguments of the action will change to a upper-case string and the action never fails 
[A|B|C|D]=generic/string/upper("AbC","Ef",["de","XYZ"]);

math/linearprogram/valueconstraint.name: math/linearprogram/valueconstraint
math/linearprogram/valueconstraint.briefdescription: add a linear value constraint to the LP.
math/linearprogram/valueconstraint.detaildescription:
The action create a value constaint with one of the definitions:
  • $ \sum_{i=1} c_i \cdot x_i = v $
  • $ \sum_{i=1} c_i \cdot x_i \geq v $
  • $ \sum_{i=1} c_i \cdot x_i \leq v $
the first $ n-2 $ arguments are the $ c_i $, the $ n-1 $ argument ist the relation symbol ( $ = $, $ \geq $ or $ \leq $) as string and the last value is the $ v $ value and the action never fails 
math/linearprogram/valueconstaint(LP,[2,5,[7,8,[9]]],"<",100);

collection/map/values.name: collection/map/values
collection/map/values.briefdescription: returns all values of the map.
collection/map/values.detaildescription:
Returns a list with all values of the argument maps and fails never 
L=collection/map/values(Map1,Map2,Map3);

collection/multimap/values.name: collection/multimap/values
collection/multimap/values.briefdescription: returns all values of the multimap.
collection/multimap/values.detaildescription:
Returns a list with all values of the argument multimaps and fails never 
L=collection/multimap/values(MultiMap1,MultiMap2,MultiMap3);

graph/vertexcount.name: graph/vertexcount
graph/vertexcount.detaildescription:
The action returns the number of vertices within a graph and never fails 
[V1|V2]=graph/vertexcount(Graph1,Graph2);

graph/vertices.name: graph/vertices
graph/vertices.briefdescription: returns all vertices of a graph.
graph/vertices.detaildescription:
The action returns a list of all vertices for each graph argument 
[V1|V2]=graph/vertices(Graph1,Graph2);
note: the returned vertex list is unmodifyable list

rest/xmlobject.name: rest/xmlobject
rest/xmlobject.briefdescription: action to call a restful webservice with XML data.
rest/xmlobject.detaildescription:
Creates a literal from an XML REST-webservice, first argument is the URL of the webservice and second argument the functor of the literal 
W=rest/xmlobject("https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Export/AgentSpeak","wikipedia");

math/bit/matrix/xor.name: math/bit/matrix/xor
math/bit/matrix/xor.briefdescription: performs the logical xor operation to all bit matrices.
math/bit/matrix/xor.detaildescription:
The action runs the logical xor operator, the first argument is the bit matrix, that is combined with all other bit matrices, so $ m_i = m_i \text{ ^ } m_1 $ is performed, the action never fails 
math/bit/matrix/xor(Matrix,Matrix1,Matrix2);

math/bit/vector/xor.name: math/bit/vector/xor
math/bit/vector/xor.briefdescription: performs the logical xor operation to all bit vectors.
math/bit/vector/xor.detaildescription:
The action runs the logical xor operator, the first argument is the bit vector, that is combined with all other bit vectors, so $ v_i = v_i \text{ ^ } v_1 $ is performed, the action never fails 
math/bit/vector/xor(Vector,Vector1,Vector2);

bool/xor.name: bool/xor
bool/xor.briefdescription: combines all arguments to a single result with the xor-operator.
bool/xor.detaildescription:
This action uses the logical exclusive-or to combine all logical arguments in a single result, the action never fails 
R=generic/bool/xor(Logical1,Logical2,[Logical3,Logical4]);

datetime/yearsbetween.name: datetime/yearsbetween
datetime/yearsbetween.briefdescription: returns the years between two dates.
datetime/yearsbetween.detaildescription:
The actions returns the number of years between two date-time objects, the action never fails 
[Y1|Y2]=datetime/yearsbetween(DateTime1,DateTime2,DateTime3,DateTime4);

collection/list/zip.name: collection/list/zip
collection/list/zip.briefdescription: creates a list of tuples with elements of two lists.
collection/list/zip.detaildescription:
Creates list of tupels of both list arguments $ \mathbb{X} $ and $ \mathbb{Y} $ and returns a list of $ \langle x_i, y_i \rangle $, the action fails never 
T=collection/list/zip([1,3,5,7],[2,4,6,8]);

datetime/zoneid.name: datetime/zoneid
datetime/zoneid.detaildescription:
The action returns the zone-id of a parsed string or date-time object, if the string is empty or "now" the current date-time is used, the action fails on wrong input 
ZoneID=datetime/zoneid("now");
